subject: junit code question
msgSnippet: Hi, I was trying to look at the junit code after having read the cook s tour, and had a question (or two): What is the significance of the Protectable
messageBody:
Hi,
I was trying to look at the junit code after having read the
cook's tour, and had a question (or two):
What is the significance of the Protectable interface that is
created anonymously within TestResult::run(final TestCase test)?
why is test.runBare() not being called directly?
Also, without intending to start a philosophical/religious debate,
I was humbly wondering why TestCase::run() creates a TestResult,
passes it to the run(TestResult) method which then turns the tables
on TestResult and asks it to run the TestCase at which point the
TestResult does the actual runBare() stuff? To my incredibly small
brain, it's difficult to understand why a TestResult should know
about running the TestCase.
Thanks,
Nilesh
